title: Seoul: North Korea fires another missile toward sea
description: South Korean officials say North Korea has launched another ballistic missile toward its eastern waters, the third such weapons test this week

title: El Salvador: 2,000 more to prison, vows will 'never return'
description: El Salvador’s government has sent 2,000 more suspects to a new prison built especially for gang members, and the justice minister vows that “they will never return” to the streets

title: Jiang Yanyong, doctor who exposed China’s SARS coverup, dies at 91
description: The Chinese state turned against Dr. Jiang when he called for accountability over the 1989 crackdowns in Tiananmen Square.

title: Trudeau names ex-governor general to examine China meddling
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has named a former governor g0eneral as a special investigator to look into allegations of Chinese interference in Canada’s last two elections

title: Honduras ditching Taiwan raises larger geopolitical concerns
description: Honduras’ decision to cut diplomatic ties with Taiwan in favor of China is yet another sign of growing Chinese influence in Latin America

title: Pakistan: 8 insurgents, 2 kids killed in battle with troops
description: Pakistan’s military says security forces have attacked a militant hideout near the Afghan border, prompting a shootout that killed eight of the insurgents and two children

title: Russia oil revenues plummeted in February as war penalties hit key sector
description: An embargo by European Union countries and a price cap imposed by the Group of Seven are hitting a major source of income for Moscow as the war in Ukraine grinds on.

title: US issues travel alert for Spring breakers in Mexico
description: The U.S. State Department has issued a travel alert for Americans planning to spend Spring break in Mexico

title: UN says intense diplomacy under way to end 8-year Yemen war
description: The U.N. special envoy for Yemen says intense diplomatic efforts are underway to end the eight-year war in Yemen

title: Mexican president floats fentanyl ban, faults US drug policy
description: Mexico’s president is calling anti-drug policies in the U.S. a failure

title: Official: EU foreign policy chief unwelcome in Israel
description: Israel has signaled to the European Union’s foreign policy chief, Josep Borrell, that he is not welcome to visit

title: UN warns gangs consuming Haiti despite help for police
description: The U.N.’s special envoy to Haiti has warned that the ongoing training and resources the international community is providing to Haiti’s police force is not enough to fight increasingly violent gangs

title: Italian novelist: Leonardo's da Vinci's mother was a slave
description: An Italian scholar has provided fresh fodder for an old debate over the identity of Leonardo da Vinci’s mother

title: Israel says roadside bomb suspect may have come from Lebanon
description: The Israeli military says soldiers killed an armed man suspected of entering the country from Lebanon and blowing up a car, raising the risk of renewing tensions with Hezbollah

title: Russia will seek to recover downed U.S. drone, Kremlin says
description: U.S. officials said that, while measures were taken to thwart Moscow’s ability to glean any intelligence from the MQ-9 Reaper, those steps are ‘not foolproof.’

title: Indigenous farmworker leader bids for Guatemala presidency
description: An Indigenous female farmworker leader hopes to become Guatemala’s next president

title: Jewish Americans press Israeli leaders to compromise
description: A senior delegation of Jewish-American leaders is paying a flash visit to Israel to urge leaders to find a compromise over Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s contentious plan to overhaul the country’s judicial system

title: Iran says 110 arrested over suspected schoolgirl poisonings
description: Iranian police say 110 suspects have been arrested in connection with the suspected poisoning of thousands of girls in schools across the country

title: Brazil reintroduces visa requirement for US tourists, others
description: Brazil has announced it is reintroducing the requirement for tourist visas for citizens of the U.S., Australia, Canada, and Japan effective from Oct. 1

title: The U.K. prime minister let his dog loose in a park. Cue a very British scandal.
description: Rishi Sunak set tongues wagging when he broke British rules in a beloved London park.

title: Colombian coal mine blast kills 11, search on for survivors
description: A powerful explosion in a coal mine in central Colombia that affected four other mines linked by tunnels has killed at least 11 people and left others missing

title: Mediterranean diet can cut heart disease risk in women by 24 percent, report says
description: Researchers say studies on the impact of a Mediterranean-type diet on heart disease have not often focused on women.

title: City of ... Garbage? Paris, amid strikes, is drowning in trash.
description: Municipal trash collectors went on strike over the French government’s proposed pension reform. Now, some 7,000 tons of trash litter Paris’ sidewalks.

title: Thai officials search for radioactive cylinder from plant
description: Authorities in Thailand have expanded their search for a metal cylinder with radioactive contents that has gone missing from a power plant, warning the public that it poses a danger to health

title: The ‘barbed-wire curtain’ dividing Europe from Russia and Belarus, visualized
description: If construction happens as expected, Europe’s “barbed-wire curtain” will span almost 1,000 miles by 2026, about a third longer than the U.S.-Mexico border wall.

title: 2 Americans appealing convictions for Italian police slaying
description: Italy’s highest court is hearing a final appeal of two U.S. citizens convicted in the stabbing death of a police officer during a plainclothes operation in Rome in the summer of 2019

title: Award-winning South African jazz singer Gloria Bosman dies
description: Smooth-voiced South African jazz musician Gloria Bosman has been lauded for her contribution to the country’s music industry in a career spanning more than two decades

title: Lion king no more: Africa’s most handsome lion slain by younger rivals
description: Bob Junior, dubbed king of the Serengeti for his famed looks, has been killed by a pack of younger, fitter lions.

title: Boat carrying migrants from Madagascar sinks; 34 drown
description: Officials in Madagascar have recovered 34 bodies from the Indian Ocean after the sinking of a boat carrying migrants hoping to get to Mayotte

title: War, transport weigh on Germany's efforts to curb emissions
description: Germany cut its greenhouse gas emissions by almost 2% last year, beating previous estimates but still falling far short of the cuts needed to meet its medium-term climate goals

title: Videos show scattered protests during Iran's fire festival
description: Videos circulating online show Iranians holding scattered anti-government protests during an annual fire festival that has ancient roots in the region

title: Blinken in Ethiopia as country recovers from Tigray conflict
description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is in Ethiopia to meet with Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed and others about the recovery from a devastating two-year conflict in the country’s Tigray region that killed hundreds of thousands of people

title: Musk internet kits a boon for bad actors in Brazilian Amazon
description: When Brazil’s environmental authority busted an illegal gold mine inside the Yanomami Indigenous territory operated by the nation’s most fearsome gang, they found something that is becoming common at such sites: a Starlink kit

title: Pakistani police battle protesters in attempt to arrest opposition leader
description: The long-brewing political crisis appeared to reach new heights in Pakistan as police fought Imran Khan's supporters outside his Lahore home.

title: North Korea really hates U.S.-South Korea military drills. Here’s why.
description: After years of reduced joint exercises, the United States and South Korea are holding their biggest drills in five years and North Korea is furious.

title: Austrian police warns of possible threat to Vienna churches
description: Austrian police are warning of a possible “Islamist-motivated attack” targeting churches in Vienna

title: Indonesia arrests 4 foreigners for alleged drug smuggling
description: Indonesian authorities say they have arrested four foreigners for allegedly trying to smuggle drugs into the country, including a Nigerian man who had swallowed dozens of capsules filled with more than 2.2 pounds of methamphetamine

title: Kangaroo-leather soccer boots are out. But roo burgers are on the menu.
description: Nike and Puma, under pressure from animal rights activists, will stop using "k-leather." Ecologists say kangaroos are suffering worse deaths through climate change.

title: Man who secretly removed condom is convicted of ‘stealthing’ by Dutch court
description: The 28-year-old was given a three-month suspended prison term and ordered to pay damages in what Dutch media said was the first such conviction in the country.

title: Cyclone Freddy to ease, in relief for Malawi, Mozambique
description: After barreling through Mozambique and Malawi since late last week and killing hundreds and displacing thousands more, Cyclone Freddy is set to move away from land Wednesday, bringing some relief to regions who have been ravaged by torrential rain and powerful winds

title: Ugandan leader's son unnerves with tweets of ambitions
description: On Twitter, the Ugandan president’s son has mused about invading neighboring Kenya, praised Russian President Vladimir Putin and offered cattle for the Italian prime minister’s hand in marriage

title: German police conduct raids on suspected people smugglers
description: German police have conducted a major raid against a group of suspected people smugglers

title: Thai policeman injured, detained after 24-hour standoff
description: Thai police have detained a senior police officer who fired multiple gunshots from his home in Bangkok, ending a standoff of over 24 hours after his colleagues tried to take him to be treated for mental illness

title: German arms industry seeks clarity on Ukraine weapons orders
description: Germany’s defense industry says it stands ready to supply Ukraine with much-needed arms and ammunition, but needs clarity about what the country requires before investing in further production capacity

title: YouTuber elected to Japan’s parliament is expelled for never showing up
description: Yoshikazu Higashitani hasn’t been in Japan, or its legislature, since his election. Experts say supporters don’t expect him to behave like a normal politician.

title: Aid dwindles for Rohingya refugees as money goes to Ukraine, other crises
description: The world’s largest refugee encampment is set to lose more than half its funding as the U.S. and others redirect their donations to other crises, the U.N. says.

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.S. summons Russian envoy after surveillance drone forced down over Black Sea
description: Russian forces were not able to recover the U.S. MQ-9 drone after the crash, the Pentagon said.

title: A railroad fan photographed Putin’s armored train. Now he lives in exile.
description: Spotting the president’s secret train was Mikhail Korotkov’s favorite hobby, until the special services sent a warning. His decision to flee is a tale of fear in wartime Russia. ,

title: Ron DeSantis shows how Western unity on Ukraine may crack
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis’s general skepticism of the Western trajectory on the war puts him in company with a group of far-right politicians in Europe.
